If you want to care for children under 8 for more than 2 hours a day, you'll need to register with Ofsted. You'll usually need to do:a home-based childcare course approved by your local council that covers the Early Years Foundation Stage framework; a paediatric first aid course; child protection training; a food safety qualification
you'll need to register with the National Registers of CommunicationsProfessionals working with Deaf and Deafblind People

You may have to do a basic skills test to show that you have the minimum standard of English and maths needed to support the educational development of children in your care. You will also need to pass an assessment of your home and any equipment you will use.
Your first step is to look at Ofsted's pre-registration briefing on becoming a childminder.
you may need a Shopfitting and Interior Contracting Competency Scheme (SICCS) card to work on some jobs

If you want to care for children under 8 for more than 2 hours a day, you'll need to register with Ofsted. You'll usually need to do:a home-based childcare course approved by your local council that covers the Early Years Foundation Stage framework; a paediatric first aid course; child protection training; a food safety qualification
you'll need to register with the National Registers of CommunicationsProfessionals working with Deaf and Deafblind People

You may have to do a basic skills test to show that you have the minimum standard of English and maths needed to support the educational development of children in your care. You will also need to pass an assessment of your home and any equipment you will use.
Your first step is to look at Ofsted's pre-registration briefing on becoming a childminder.
you may need a Shopfitting and Interior Contracting Competency Scheme (SICCS) card to work on some jobs
